item.title: The zlib Algorithm for Text/Binary File Classification
item.description: The R code in this post is also available at this GitHub Gist. Photo by Alp Duran. Intro In some situations, we want to know whether a file is a text file or a binary file programmatically. For example, as a text editor developer, you can use this information to choose the correct editing interface (text editor or hex editor). Similarly, if you want to pack or compress a collection of files into a compact format, it helps to know the type of file before encoding them.
